text:
Memorials St Thomas' Church, St Annes from stonechaser.blogspot.com Located in the quaint town of St. Annes, the St. Thomas Church stands as a testament to the town’s rich history and architectural heritage. Built in the late 19th century, the church has undergone several renovations and restorations over the years, but has managed to retain its original charm and beauty. Today, the church is not only a place of worship, but also a popular tourist attraction for visitors to the town.
The St. Thomas Church boasts a stunning gothic-style architecture that is reminiscent of the medieval era. Its high vaulted ceilings and intricate stained glass windows are a sight to behold, and are a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of the builders who constructed it. The church’s bell tower, which stands at an imposing 100 feet, is one of the tallest in the town, and offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.
One of the most impressive features of the St. Thomas Church is its organ. Built in 1902 by the esteemed organ builder William Hill & Son, the organ is considered to be one of the finest examples of Victorian organ building in the country. It has been meticulously maintained over the years, and is still in use today, providing a rich and vibrant sound that fills the church’s interior with music and song.

The church’s nave is flanked by two aisles, which are lined with intricately carved wooden pews. The chancel, which houses the altar, is adorned with beautiful stained glass windows that depict scenes from the Bible. The church’s intricate stonework and decorative arches are a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of the builders who constructed it.
The Church’s Community Involvement The St. Thomas Church is not just a place of worship, but also a pillar of the community. The church hosts a variety of events and activities throughout the year, including concerts, art exhibitions, and community fairs. The church also runs a number of outreach programs, including a food bank and a homeless shelter, which provide vital support to the local community.
The Church’s Role in History The St. Thomas Church has played an important role in the history of St. Annes. During World War II, the church served as a refuge for local residents who were displaced by the bombings. The church also played a key role in the reconstruction efforts that followed the war, providing much-needed support and resources to the community. Today, the church continues to be an important part of the town’s history and cultural heritage.
The Church’s Role in the Arts The St. Thomas Church has long been a patron of the arts. The church hosts a variety of cultural events throughout the year, including concerts, art exhibitions, and theater performances. The church’s beautiful architecture and acoustics make it an ideal venue for these events, and many local artists and musicians have benefited from the support of the church and its community.
Conclusion The St. Thomas Church in St. Annes is a true gem of the town’s architectural heritage. Its stunning gothic-style architecture, intricate interior design, and rich history make it a must-visit destination for anyone interested in the town’s cultural heritage. Whether you’re a history buff, a music lover, or simply looking for a peaceful place to reflect and pray, the St. Thomas Church is a place that should not be missed.
